intro: Telipogon polyneuros, commonly known as the slender sand sedge, is a flowering plant native to the wetlands and marshes of South America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and compact growth habit. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. It thrives in moist, nutrient-poor soils and is often found in coastal and inland wetland habitats. Due to its specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
